channel.title: Item manipulation? [Gold Bars]
channel.description: I currently own 319947 gold bars is there anyway I could manipulate the price in f2p and make the prices of the gold bars go higher since I have a shit ton?

item.title: Item manipulation? [Gold Bars]
item.dc:creator: @maminerr maminerr
item.description:
@maminerr wrote:

Gold bar, me sorry haha
Also, Ive been plank making for 99 mage and I take back what I said! People have bought the majority of their supplies, best to wait a week or so when people get on and say OH FUCK THATS RIGHT and try buy buy buy :3
I dont recommend selling stuff after the weekend though as prices will most likely dip due to the influx of items.

Read full topic

you again with the cold! :mad: she’s right, though - sell with in the next few days

I dont know if you still have your bars, but theres a double xp weekend on the 16th of March. Players wanting to make ammys for crafting may need cold bars?

item.title: Item manipulation? [Gold Bars]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

n3ss3s:

Maybe you should try to concentrate on updates Jagex makes, I was 10 hours late so I missed the chance to buy them out, but when flasks came out I bought Super str(6)'s for about 8M, and it took about 4 hours to sell them all for 14m.

The thing is, most half intelligent people realize this, and so because everyone runs to buy them, they drive the price up. When everyone tries selling, they crash the price and a lot of people lose money. The only viable way to earn money is to predict this range of time and buy as early as possible, and sell as late as possible before everyone else does, so you end up selling to those who are trying to buy, right before the item crashes. That’s not an easy thing to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Item manipulation? [Gold Bars]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“SETO, post:19, topic:432144”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=534854.msg3915902#msg3915902 date=1329176138]
I think it’s worth mentioning that economics is also a very uncertain field, and in the terms of the RuneScape economy, you have to use schools of macroeconomics to try and evaluate the market. You can use basic principles of supply and demand behavior to try and predict the impacts of certain actions (such as buying a very large number of items), but using that approach alone is very naive. There are many factors to consider, both short-term and long-term. And even then, there is never any true certainty in how the market behaves.

Best method would be taking a long-term statistical approach whilst taking into consideration anomalies, like the recent bot nuke. Although that’s still an uncertain method, you can at least predict the level of certainty, accuracy, and precision of your extrapolations.
[/quote]
lol when i left rs, while bots were up, out of bordem i bought clay for 20M (@5gp), now i am a billionaire[/quote]

Lmao, brilliant.

Read full topic

item.title: Item manipulation? [Gold Bars]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

I think it’s worth mentioning that economics is also a very uncertain field, and in the terms of the RuneScape economy, you have to use schools of macroeconomics to try and evaluate the market. You can use basic principles of supply and demand behavior to try and predict the impacts of certain actions (such as buying a very large number of items), but using that approach alone is very naive. There are many factors to consider, both short-term and long-term. And even then, there is never any true certainty in how the market behaves.

Best method would be taking a long-term statistical approach whilst taking into consideration anomalies, like the recent bot nuke. Although that’s still an uncertain method, you can at least predict the level of certainty, accuracy, and precision of your extrapolations.

item.title: Item manipulation? [Gold Bars]
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“zammyking111, post:12, topic:432144”]Lol but the markets are based off of the US Stock exchange so technically you can learn stocks from RS, then you can use the info you learned off of RS to invest in real stocks in real life and make bank!

the game is called

Buy Low - Sell High[/quote]

Anyone can come up with that. I’ve never met someone who got rich by doing the opposite. Unless you have enough money to manipulate the market, the market dictates your actions. Being able to interpret signs is a skill a lot of people lack. You might be lucky in the short term, but on the long run you need to know how to read the market and stick to your own rules without emotions taking over.

Read full topic

item.title: Item manipulation? [Gold Bars]
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“zammyking111, post:12, topic:432144”][quote author=Teh Spede link=topic=534854.msg3912352#msg3912352 date=1328880524]

no i didnt get 99 smithing i just invested in a shit tons of gold figuring it would go up
[/quote]RS isnt real life bro

Lol but the markets are based off of the US Stock exchange so technically you can learn stocks from RS, then you can use the info you learned off of RS to invest in real stocks in real life and make bank!

the game is called

Buy Low - Sell High[/quote]That’s absurd.

Read full topic

item.title: Item manipulation? [Gold Bars]
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

You can attempt to buy out. In terms, “Buy out” would be where you buy the max amount of one item and let the demand for them raise. Thus, the price raises aswell. This usually only works efficiently with large Buyout clans.

Read full topic

item.description:

I’d just make them into gold bracelets, then sell them to the rogue trader. You’re guaranteed money for each bar that way, and you get a good chunk of crafting experience (25 xp per bracelet).
